title: NOMOFOBIA
description: Esta presentación se presenta como una introducción para trabajar con los alumn@s todo el tema relacionado con las tecnoadicciones y el uso responsable del teléfono móvil.En la Slide 1: se introduce el tema llevando a los alumnos a qu ese den cuenta de que hay muchas adicciones en el mundo que les rodea.En la Slide 2: se le muestra al alumno un vídeo con una serie de cuestiones a las que debe ir respondiendo de forma personal.En la Slide 3: se ve que si la mayoría de mis respuestas son positivas puede ser que tengo un problema respecto a la dependencia que tengo del móvil, o si por el contrario son negativas (o los alumnos que en primer lugar han dado al positivo), ven que pautas pueden o deben seguir para hacer un uso responsable del móvil, This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., Concienciar a los alumn@s sobre el uso adecuado del teléfono móvil y los problemas de adicción en los que pueden caer., License: 'Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial'. title: THE PHONBIES
description: Experimentando con la tecnología nos encontramos en un momento intenso de cambios, desconocemos las edades más o menos apropiadas y empezamos a encontrarnos con problemas de conducta, de vista y posturales, problemas de COMPRENSIÓN LECTORA (asistiendo, al mismo tiempo, al enriquecimiento de nuevas formas de competencia lectora). EN EL GRAN CAPITÁN, CENTRO TECNOLÓGICO, HEMOS ANALIZADO ESTA COMPETENCIA LECTORA PARA QUE SIRVA COMO EJEMPLO DE QUE UN USO RESPONSABLE DE LAS TECNOLOGÍAS PUEDE MEJORAR LA COMPETENCIA LECTORA., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., Nombrar sobre los problemas conductuales, de vista y posturales de un uso inadecuado de las TIC. title: Essen und Trinken
description: En esta unidad se trabajan contenidos gramaticales relacionados con la estructura de la frase, la declinación, haciendo hincapié en el uso del dativo, verbos y preposiciones que rigen dativo, así como el uso del pronombre posesivo en todas sus formas.Los verbos modales son también un elemento de repaso, su empleo debe surgir espontáneamente  y no generar ningún problema. Las situaciones de comunicación que debes aprender están relacionadas con comer y beber en cualquier contexto: en casa, con amigos en el restaurante, etc. Además debes saber desenvolverte haciendo la compra. Conversar sobre este tema con amigos debe surgir de manera fluida.Finalmente podrás entender las ideas principales y la comprensión selectiva de textos tanto orales como escritos relacionados con este tema y adecuados a tu nivel.Junto con tus compañeros elaborarás un dossier con vuestras recetas favoritas., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., License: 'None (All rights reserved)'. title: Euglena: A Remote Online Microbiology Lab
description: Welcome! This is a lab inquiry space for the Euglena laboratory. This learning space was designed primarily for 12-14 year old students.In this remote lab, students can test the effects of light on the photosynthetic single-celled organism /Euglena gracilis/. The lab is located at Stanford University and houses a real /E. gracilis /population inside a microfluidic chamber that is placed under the microscope. On each side of the microfluidic chamber is an LED light; the brightness of these lights can be controlled with a virtual "joystick" and hence the response (or lack of response) of the /E. gracilis/ to light can be tested.Please note: we are still in the beta phase for the lab, so it may be down at some times. , This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., License: 'Creative Commons Attribution'. title: Plan Actividades Grupo Proyectos Europeos
description: El Grupo de Proyectos Europeos del IES David Buján tiene planeado desarrollar el siguiente Plan de Actividades durante el Curso 2013-2014, This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., O Grupo dede Proxectos Europeos, pretende favorecer o contacto das familias e o resto da comunidade educativa, cos alumnos participantes na actividade a levar a cabo nese momento.Ao longo destes anos, pretendemos visitar diferentes paises, coñecer distintas culturas, non como meros turistas, senón como invitados. O vivir durante unha, duas ou tres semanas nos fogares de cada un dos nosos "partners", empaparannos, sen querer, dos seus costumes, tradición ou idioma. A visita dos nosos invitados, ao centro, provocará, sen dúbida, un efecto similar. Creemos que o mellor xeito de "facer do mundo a nosa casa" é coñecendo e respectando as súas culturas., License: 'Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial'. For additional information or questions regarding copyright, distribution and reproduction, visit http://vishub.org/terms_of_use .

title: Earth's magnetic field: cutting edge research in its past, present and future
description: Interactive movie aimed at your students, age 10 to 14.Cutting edge research in this domain is introduced, focusing on the change of the magnetic field in the past and the future.In this movie, you will learn about the impact of the Earth's magnetic field on our daily life, the change in the magnetic field over the years and millions of years, and the description of what happens during a pole reversal., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., This video presents three cutting edge research videos, carried out by Prof A. Jackson and Prof D. Gubbins, on the evolution of the magnetic field through time, firstly in the past using ship logs data and in the future, looking at how this field could change during a pole reversal event. This video also presents the shape of the magnetic dipole as we go deeper towards the Earth's core. The oversimplified dipole evolves into a rather complex quadrupole structure. , License: 'Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial'. For additional information or questions regarding copyright, distribution and reproduction, visit http://vishub.org/terms_of_use .

title: O Coelhinho da Seleção Natural
description: A teoria da Selecção Natural apresentada em 1859 no livro "A origem das espécies" escrito por Charles Darwin é uma das teorias fundamentais da Biologia. Nesta atividade o aluno é conduzido, através de três experiências em que são simuladas diferentes condições de seleção, a testar hipóteses sobre evolução segundo os mecanismos de seleção natural. title: Bisel method in Hungary
description: The Biotic IndexThe Biotic Index (BI) is a biological water quality assessment method for water courses. It is a simple method that permits one to gain a clear insight into the ecological quality of water courses with very limited means. Biological water quality assessment is a valuable supplement to chemical water quality assessment systems, scientifically as well as educationally.The Belgian variant (Belgian Biotic Index, BBI) was set and repeatedly tested by a cooperation of several laboratories. Since 1984 it is the offical standard method for biological water quality assessment in Belgium. This BBI  has proven to be much more applicable, with slight adaptations, than merely in Belgium, at  least all over Europe.Concerning application at the secondary education level the  BBI has one big advantage compared to other methods (standardized elsewhere in Europe): the assessment of the biotic index is quick, easy and requires no work for a specialist or big investments.In the educational field the BI integrates in an active way (field work) the biology lessons  of classifications and ecology: the  determination of the macro invertebrates is based on the principles of  the biological classification system and its interpretation in terms of water quality is connected with human influences on the environment. When the assessment of the biotic index is combined with chemical water  analyses, clear conclusions can (mostly) be drawn concerning the cause of the pollution and thus we have an integration of the biology and chemistry lessons., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., Method:1. Sampling: try to catch as many various species of water organisms as possible.2. Sample processing: identify and enumerate them. 3. Interpretation: classify them according to their sensibility to water pollution and express your results as a score for the biological water quality., License: 'Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial'. For additional information or questions regarding copyright, distribution and reproduction, visit http://vishub.org/terms_of_use .

title: Discover the Z boson
description: Students will use the experimental data collected by the ATLAS experiment at CERN to “discover” invisible particles and calculate their mass. For this purpose they will identify different lepton types and use Einstein’s famous equation for the equivalence of mass and energy. They will also us vector addition to add the momenta of several particles which are the decay products of the invisible particles. The particle they will be looking for is the particle responsible for the weak force, the Z boson., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., License: 'Creative Commons Attribution'. title: Essen und Trinken
description: En esta unidad se trabajan contenidos gramaticales relacionados con la estructura de la frase, la declinación, haciendo hincapié en el uso del dativo, verbos y preposiciones que rigen dativo, así como el uso del pronombre posesivo en todas sus formas.Los verbos modales son también un elemento de repaso, su empleo debe surgir espontáneamente  y no generar ningún problema. Las situaciones de comunicación que debes aprender están relacionadas con comer y beber en cualquier contexto: en casa, con amigos en el restaurante, etc. Además debes saber desenvolverte haciendo la compra. Conversar sobre este tema con amigos debe surgir de manera fluida.Finalmente podrás entender las ideas principales y la comprensión selectiva de textos tanto orales como escritos relacionados con este tema y adecuados a tu nivel.Junto con tus compañeros elaborarás un dossier con vuestras recetas favoritas., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., License: 'Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial'. title: Biodiversitatea in Delta Dunarii
description: Omul își desfășoară activitatea într-un mediu natural format  din mai  multe sisteme ecologice .Conservarea biodiversităţii la nivel de ecosisteme, specii şi populaţii a devenit din ce în ce mai dificilă pentru că în ultimii ani  s-a deteriorat capitalul  natural  cu efecte complexe pe termen lung, datorat în mare parte intensificării  impactului uman.Unul din motivele pentru care Delta Dunării a devenit rezervaţie a biosferei este acela că, în comparaţie cu alte delte ale Europei şi chiar ale Terrei, a păstrat o biodiversitate mai ridicată, prin aceasta întelegându-se un număr mare de specii dintr-o mare diversitate de unităţi sistematice. Mai mult decât  atât, Delta Dunării frapează prin densitatea ridicată la multe specii, care sunt rare sau lipsesc din alte zone ale continentului, cu toate că din cauza efectelor activităţilor antropice din ultimele decenii şi efectivele acestor specii ca şi habitatele lor au fost grav afectate., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., Creşterea gradului de conştientizare a elevilor şi cadrelor didactice privind problemele de mediu , dezvoltarea spiritului critic şi a capacităţii elevilor de a lua decizii  prin  popularizarea  , amenajarea şi pastrarea spaţiului verde si  protejarea  tuturor speciilor  din Delta Dunării.  , License: 'Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial'. For additional information or questions regarding copyright, distribution and reproduction, visit http://vishub.org/terms_of_use .

title: cultivo de lehuga irofovicas
description: La lechuga es conocida desde la Antigüedad por sus propiedades relajantes y sedantes, por lo que se la recomienda para el insomnio. Combate la fatiga y la anemia por su alto contenido en hierro, es fuente de antioxidantes, es diurética, regula los niveles de azúcar en sangre y fortalece las vías respiratorias. title: testing the drinking water
description: Testing the quality of drinking waterOne of our Comenius project aims was test drinking water quality of each country.We used for it the AQUANAL – Water Laboratory, which contains six tests onsubstances dissolved in water. Ammonium, Nitrate, Nitrite, Phosphate, ph-value andTotal hardness. The test result is determined from a color chart.The examination of the four „indicators” already mentioned for the pollution of water(nitrate, nitrite, ammonium and phosphate), along with the determination of waterhardness and the ph value, will produce a clear picture of the quality of the water., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., License: 'Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial'. title: Methyl orange
description: This ILS is based on the learning materials developed by Lisette van Rens of the VU Amsterdam. Adapted by Henny Leemkuil, (Department of Instructional Technology, University of Twente). In this ILS students will: * Gain knowledge about the chemistry of acids and bases and on the process   of diazotation. * Gain knowledge on the production of methyl orange in a micro reactor. * Judge the accuracy and reliability of research. * Design a 'fair' inquiry, measure accurately, determine whether   measurements are reliable and lead to valid conclusions. * Be part of a simulated research community and gain knowledge on peer   discussion.Pre university students will use a remote lab with real equipment. They can operate the micro reactor from their own computer and can see what they are doing by means of webcams that are situated around the micro reactor. Students have to make a reservation to use the lab for 50 minutes. The ILS will take several lessons and involves homework. Warning! To run the Methyl Orange experiment you need additional plugins for Java [1] and Silverlight [2]. [1] http://www.java.com/en/download/index.jsp[2] http://www.microsoft.com/silverlight/, This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., License: 'Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial'. title: JURASSIC PARK
description: Esta película trata de la creación de los dinosaurios por medio de la clonación y de cadenas de ADN. La investigación se llevó a cabo gracias a los mosquitos, que les sacaban la sangre a los dinosaurios. Estos, al posarse en los árboles quedaban atrapados en la sabia.Con el tiempo la sabia se solidificó y fosilizó haciendo que los mosquitos quedasen inmóviles en el interior. Después,se les extrae la sangre que le habían sacado al dinosaurio, This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., License: 'None (All rights reserved)'. title: Sobran las palabras
description: La inteligencia interpersonal, la que se emplea para relacionarse con otras personas, percibir estados de ánimo, emociones y comunicarse, se aborda aquí mediante una colección de animaciones que ilustran diferentes situaciones en las que se emplea el lenguaje no verbal para comunicarse con los demás., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., La inteligencia interpersonal no parece depender del lenguaje  verbal.En esta excursión se invita al uso de la propia capacidad para detectar lo que quieren o no quieren expresar las personas a través de su lenguaje corporal.Esta capacidad se da en forma altamente sofisticada en los líderes religiosos y políticos, en los maestros y profesores, en los terapeutas y en los padres.Está relacionada con dos factores peculiares de la especie humana. Uno, la prolongada duración de la infancia en los primates, incluyendo la estrecha relación con la madre. Cuando se sufre una pérdida en esta etapa el desarrollo interpersonal corre serio peligro. Otro factor es la importancia de la relación social para los humanos. Cazar o rastrear era una actividad de las sociedades prehistóricas que requerían la participación y cooperación de una gran cantidad de gente. La necesidad de cohesión en el grupo, de liderazgo, de organización y de solidaridad surge de forma natural. Referencias:Inteligencias múltiples. Howar Gardner.The human animal. Desmond MorrisEl lenguaje no verbal. Alan Pease, License: 'Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial'. For additional information or questions regarding copyright, distribution and reproduction, visit http://vishub.org/terms_of_use .

title: How are the light fixtures in a house connected?
description: The basic idea of the lesson is to familiarize the students with the elements that compose a simple electric circuit (as well as electric circuits in general) and to introduce them to both parallel and in series circuit setups. After that they formulate their hypotheses and conduct scientific investigations in order to compare the electric current flowing through each light bulb between two setups (in series and parallel) and with the brightness of the bulb of a simple circuit. They will also compare the electric current flowing through each light bulb in two setups with the electric current flowing through the simple electric circuit and understand what happens to the electric current when they add more light bulbs. Then, they will investigate what happens to the light bulbs in each setup if a bulb blows out. Then, they will form conclusions based on the evidence collected and decide the setup that light bulbs in a house are connected., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., License: 'Creative Commons Attribution'. title: Tipología de las fortificaciones
description: Finalizada la Guerra Civil, Franco decidió la fortificación de la frontera con Francia. Con ese objetivo se iniciaron las obras que, con mayor o menor intensidad, prosiguieron hasta una fecha tan avanzada como 1957. Por su particular emplazamiento el valle del Baztán constituía una posible vía para la hipotética invasión aliada y debido a ello fue de las zonas con mayor densidad de obras defensivas construidas. A continuación estudiaremos los principales tipos de fortificación, This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., 1. Conocer la realidad del valle del Baztan durante el primer franquismo.2. Comprender la táctica militar de la época y visualizar su presencia en la actualidad. 3. Mostrar preocupación por las atrocidades de la represión franquista.4. Creación e interpretación de fuentes iconográficas referidas a esta cuestión.5. Utilización de fuentes arqueológicas referidas a esta cuestión.6. Revalorización del patrimonio cercano como una fuente de enriquecimiento cultural y económico., License: 'Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial'. title: Around the world - the school trip around the world with t-shirts, books, geography and fieldwork swirled.
description: 1.stage: "Collecting t-shirts"Students collect t-shirts with a sign on it: name of cites, countries, states, rivers... T-shirts are sorted and analyzed by geographical area and region. Studenst prepare an exhibition of t-shirts in the school hall and classrooms.2.stage: "Telling a story"Lectures and workshops with guests (travel writers, sailors, adventurers and world travelers). Reading and researching travelogues and logbooks.3.stage: "Sail around, fly and experience the world"Creating an itinerary according to the collected shirts by land, see and air. Writing a travel guide.4.stage: "Mathematical Adventures"Calculate the itinerary using the coordinate system.5.stage: "Cultural similarities and differences"Research cultural similarities and differences according to collected t-shirts.6.stage:"Fieldrip"boat ride, visit some place according to collected t-shirts, find and visit a partner-school7.stage: Evaluations, This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., License: 'Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial'. title: Go-Lab tutorial
description: Do you know how to use this Go-Lab Portal to explore the online labs and create your own inquiry learning spaces? We have created an inquiry space with instructional videos to show how the Go-Lab portal works! We recommend our users strongly to start with this tutorial to gain an insight of the portal. Try it right now!If you want to integrate other tutorials related to this topic, we recommend you that you sign up in Graasp. After that, you could copy this inquiry space to create your own inquiry space by clicking the button under the image. As an overview: This space introduces the scope and functionality of the Go-Lab platforms for inquiry learning. Golabz focuses on providing the necessary resources for teachers for inquiry activities fostering sharing and reuse of these resources. title: Iberian Lynx
description: This excursion is about the Iberian Lynx, one of the most endangered cat species in the world. Lynx have a short tail and characteristic tufts of black hair on the tips of their ears; large, padded paws for walking on snow; and long whiskers on the face. Under their neck, they have a ruff which has black bars, is not very visible, and resembles a bow tie., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., Learn about the Iberian Lynx., License: 'Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial'. title: cultivon hidroponico de tomate
description: Los tomates hidropónicos se plantan en una solución de nutrientes en lugar del suelo. Por lo general, se colocan en un material sin tierra que pueda soportar sus raíces y retener los nutrientes. Cultivar tomates de forma hidropónica te permite cultivarlos en un ambiente controlado que reduce las posibilidades de que padezcan enfermedades, facilita un crecimiento más rápido y garantiza una mayor producción de frutos. Sin embargo, el cultivo hidropónico requiere mucho más trabajo y, en ocasiones, es más costoso que el cultivo normal de tomates; en especial si nunca antes has implementado un sistema hidropónico., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., License: 'Creative Commons Reconocimiento-NoComercial'. title: f.e.m de las pilas
description: En este ILS el alumno investiga de qué  variables depende la f.e.m de una pila  y cómo depende de ellas. Sigue las fases propias del método científico y una vez ha formulado las hipótesis, utiliza  un laboratorio virtual para contrastarlas y sacar las conclusiones correspondientes.Our objective is to study the variation of cell potential with change in the concentration of electrolytes  at room temperature. Students understand the terms, electrochemical cell, electrolytic cell, Daniell cell, salt bridge, EMF. Students acquire the skill to construct a Daniell cell. Students understand the significance of salt bridge. Students acquire the skill to calculate the electrode potential of a half cell and full cell using the Nernst equation. Students acquire the skill to measure the EMF of a cell by viewing animation & simulator. Students understand how the electrode potential of a given cell varies with the concentration of electrolytes in the anodic and cathodic half cell.  , This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., License: 'Creative Commons Attribution'. For additional information or questions regarding copyright, distribution and reproduction, visit http://vishub.org/terms_of_use .

title: Identificación de Minerales
description: Identificaremos minerales en el laboratorio gracias a códigos QR.Hemos escogido los minerales más habituales y así, cada profesor podrá adaptar nuestra idea a su laboratorio., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., El estudio de los minerales suele ser un tema árido para los alumnos de los cursos inferiores. Por ello, los alumnos de Geología de 2º de bachillerato, intentamos transmitir el interés que nosotros mismos tenemos, a través de esta actividad lectiva al tiempo que sencilla.OBJETIVOS:- Intentar que los alumnos adquieran, de forma divertida, conocimientos sobre los minerales de nuestro laboratorio de geología.- Incrementar la competencia científica. Identificaremos minerales atendiendo a sus propiedades físicas y químicas, siguiendo el guión de prácticas de ViSH en el móvil al tiempo que nos sirve como  guía de minerales, con indicación de las características generales y localización geográfica.- Incrementar la competencia digital. Utilización de códigos QR, uso de móviles o tablets, manejo de la plataforma ViSH en el aula.Nota.- Hemos adaptado los tamaños de letra y las características de escritura a un visionado sencillo desde nuestro móvil., License: 'None (All rights reserved)'. title: La búsqueda y organización de la información
description: Al plantearse la escritura de un texto una de las primeras decisiones tienen que ver con el contenido temático del mismo. ¿Qué sé sobre este tema? ¿Qué no sé? ¿Qué necesito buscar? ¿Dónde lo puedo encontrar?El desarrollo y generalización del uso de la red ha provocado cambios fundamentales en el acceso a la información. Hoy en día el problema no es como antiguamente encontrar la información que sólo estaba al alcance de unos pocos, sino gestionarla, saber cómo guardarla, clasificarla... para poder reutilizarla., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., License: 'Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial'. title: GripeNet.es
description: GripeNet.es es una herramienta cuyo objetivo primordial es monitorizar la incidencia de la gripe en España a través de la colaboración desinteresada y anónima de voluntarios vía Internet. El proyecto tiene un doble propósito. Por una parte, los datos recogidos permitirán a los investigadores avanzar en el conocimiento de los mecanismos de propagación de las enfermedades infecciosas y, por otra, el proyecto constituirá una herramienta de divulgación para acercar la ciencia al ciudadano e involucrarlo directamente en el estudio científico a través de la información facilitada.  ¡Participa tú también y ayúdanos a prevenir la gripe en España!, This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., License: 'Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial'. title: SPELEOLOGIE ET SCIENCES CONNEXES - 1. Introduction à la spéléologie
description: La spéléologie est une branche de la karstologie, science qui étudie les phénomènes karstiques.Sous « l’étiquette » SPELEOLOGIES ET SCIENCES CONNEXES, vous découvrirez des chapitres relatifs à la spéléogénèse dans différentes roches, les spéléothèmes et le concrétionnement, la microbiologie des grottes, les processus karstiques, les dépôts chimiques dans les grottes, les archives paléoclimatiques, la volcanospéléologie, la biospéléologie, les traceurs artificiels, l’archéologie, la vulnérabilité des grottes, l’exploration-la protection-la gestion des grottes... La plupart de ces informations sont disponibles en anglais, espagnol et italien., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., License: 'None (All rights reserved)'. title: tostadora de cafe
description: El proceso de tueste se dedica íntegramente a producir un café sabroso. Cuando se tuesta, el grano de café verde aumenta su tamaño hasta casi el doble, cambiando en color y densidad. Dado que el grano absorbe calor, el color cambia a amarillo, después a un ligero color marrón, y finalmente a un color oscuro y aceitoso. Durante el tueste aparecen aceites en la superficie del grano. El tueste continuará oscureciendo el café hasta que se elimine de la fuente de calor., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., License: 'Creative Commons Reconocimiento-NoComercial'. So if you install a photovoltaic module now, it will produce more energy every year. This is the one and only confident chance to get unbelievably rich within at least 10 years. title: CineforumTierra
description: Una larga expedición, con el sol como guía, en la que acompañamos con sus crías a una osa polar, unaelefanta en su largo recorrido desde el desierto del Kalahari hasta el delta del Okavango, y a una ballenajorobada en su largo viaje de 6.500 km. desde las aguas tropicales hasta el Antártico. Con ellos conoceremos,siguiendo el ritmo de las estaciones, la belleza de los diferentes hábitats naturales de nuestro planeta, perotambién los efectos del calentamiento global en los polos, la insaciable voracidad del desierto, el cansanciode los océanos por los cambios en las corrientes y la irregularidad de los ciclos climáticos que afectandirectamente a su productividad y sus repercusiones en la vida animal y vegetal., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., License: 'None (All rights reserved)'. title: Identificación de Minerales
description: Identificaremos minerales en el laboratorio gracias a códigos QR.Hemos escogido los minerales más habituales y así, cada profesor podrá adaptar nuestra idea a su laboratorio., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., El estudio de los minerales suele ser un tema árido para los alumnos de los cursos inferiores. Por ello, los alumnos de Geología de 2º de bachillerato, intentamos transmitir el interés que nosotros mismos tenemos, a través de esta actividad lectiva al tiempo que sencilla.OBJETIVOS:- Intentar que los alumnos adquieran, de forma divertida, conocimientos sobre los minerales de nuestro laboratorio de geología.- Incrementar la competencia científica. Identificaremos minerales atendiendo a sus propiedades físicas y químicas, siguiendo el guión de prácticas de ViSH en el móvil al tiempo que nos sirve como  guía de minerales, con indicación de las características generales y localización geográfica.- Incrementar la competencia digital. Utilización de códigos QR, uso de móviles o tablets, manejo de la plataforma ViSH en el aula.Nota.- Hemos adaptado los tamaños de letra y las características de escritura a un visionado sencillo desde nuestro móvil., License: 'None (All rights reserved)'. For additional information or questions regarding copyright, distribution and reproduction, visit http://vishub.org/terms_of_use .

title: Webcam Doñana
description: Esta cámara está situada en las instalaciones del centro de cría de Lince Ibérico en Doñana, ubicadas en la zona denominada “El Acebuche”. Aquí se ha implementado, por primera vez con éxito, un programa de cría en cautividad de este felino, lo que representa una esperanza muy fundada de conservación de la especie. La cámara presenta en directo el comportamiento de ejemplares de lince en condiciones muy parecidas a las que se dan en Doñana de manera natural. A veces, los técnicos que vigilan a los linces cautivos sustituyen las imágenes en directo por otras pregrabadas., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., License: 'None (All rights reserved)'. title: Remote Photovoltaic Lab
description: One of the most important concerns of the energy policy is solar energy systems education and promoting solar energy applications for sustainable development. The photovoltaic panel converts solar energy to electricity and represents the main element of a photovoltaic system. Studying the characteristic curve of a panel is essential in the study of photovoltaics since it provides important details about the electrical characteristics of the panel and it is used for simulation, design, and performance analysis of photovoltaic systems.Thus, the assessment of the effectiveness of a photovoltaic module requires knowledge of its characteristic curve., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., License: 'Creative Commons Attribution'. title: RRLAB
description: Sistema de unidades didácticas de física que utiliza la realidad remota con el objetivo de que los alumnos sean capaces de comprender de una forma más atractiva y precisa los conceptos que están estudiando en clase. El sistema desarrollado es una mezcla de realidad virtual más realidad aumentada: disponemos de un entorno real, al que superponemos elementos virtuales, pero el detalle más novedoso consiste en que tanto el entorno real como los elementos virtuales pueden ser modificados por el usuario del sistema, y todo ello se puede hacer desde un lugar físico distinto, de manera remota., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., License: 'Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial'. title: Resistance and Resistivity measurements
description: The resistance of an electrical conductor depends on several factors. Its physical shape is one factor. The type of conductor material is another, as might be expected. That is, two conductors with the same physical shape, but of different materials, have different resistances. This important material characteristic of resistance is expressed in terms of a quantity called resistivity.The ILS shows you how you can do resistance and resitivity measurements in the lab and you will understad how would change the resistance of a wire conductor If the length were to double or the Area were to double., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., License: 'Creative Commons Attribution'. title: The origins of Cinema.
description:
The purpose of this excursion is to make students understand the basic principles of animation and cinema. Through their predecessors, various optical toys, they will understand how  we reached at today's modern cinema. Amusing activities and constructions will make them enter into the spirit and sense of animation., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., After this excursion students will:

Learn the origins of animation and cinema.
Familiarize with old optical toys such as thaumatrope, zoetrope, flip-books etc.
Understand the optical phenomenon of retinal persistence as a basic principle of making animated pictures.
Try to construct their own optical toys and develop short animated stories., License: 'Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial'. For additional information or questions regarding copyright, distribution and reproduction, visit http://vishub.org/terms_of_use .

title: Cultivo De Cafe *.*
description: La calidad del café depende de numerosos factores. La calidad depende de la especie vegetal que se utilice (Robusta o Arábica) de la variedad de café sembrada (ver historia del café). Además de los factores genéticos, depende obviamente del árbol y el entorno en que crece. Adicionalmente, la forma como se siembra el café y el adecuado manejo agronómico del cultivo, también influenciará la calidad., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., License: 'Creative Commons Reconocimiento-NoComercial'. title: Színes kémia
description: A pH nemcsak a kémhatást, hanem a kémhatás mértékét is megmutatja. A 7-nél kisebb pH-jú oldatok savas kémhatásúak. Minél kisebb a pH-ja egy savas oldatnak, annál erősebben savas. A 7-nél nagyobb pH-jú oldatok lúgos kémhatásúak: közülük a nagyobb pH-jú a lúgosabb.Univerzális indikátor:savas oldatokban, pH < 7 - vörös,semleges oldatokban, pH = 7 - zöld,lúgos oldatokban, pH > 7 - kék, majd lila, This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., License: 'Creative Commons Attribution'. title: Stars Wars. Episodio I: LA AMENAZA FANTASMA.
description: Esta es una película de ciencia ficción llena de efectos especiales que innovaron el cine de aquellos años y sorprendio a todo al que la fue a ver por primera vez. En ella ademas de sorprendentes efectos especiales, se describe la Galaxia desde el punto de vista de la mente creadora de esta película,concretamente nos habla de un pequeño planeta llamado Naboo, el cual obviamente no existe, en el  se centran practicamente todos los acontecimientos que suceden a lo largo de la película.Esta nos cuenta que  la República Galáctica está sumida en el caos. Los impuestos de las rutas comerciales a los sistemas estelares exteriores están en disputa. Por otro lado esperando resolver el asunto con un bloqueo de poderosas naves de guerra, la codiciosa Federación de Comercio ha detenido todos los envíos al pequeño planeta de Naboo.Para resolver este problema  el Canciller Supremo del Congreso de la Repúblicaha enviado en secreto a dos Caballeros Jedi, guardianes de la paz y la justicia en la galaxia., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., License: 'Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial'. title: Robotica educativa
description: Nella società che sta mutando, lo sviluppo delle scienze e della tecnologia ha cambiato il nostro modo di vivere e di comunicare. Le informazioni che giungono attraverso diversi tipi di canali di comunicazione, impongono che i ragazzi imparino a interpretarle, per essere protagonisti attivi in grado di porsi problemi, comprendere le cause e studiare strategie efficaci di risoluzione, acquisendo consapevolezza delle conseguenze delle proprie scelte. L’utilizzo della robotica educativa consente un apprendimento partecipato e costruito a partire dall’esperienza. I ragazzi acquisiscono competenze attraverso la ricerca, il confronto tra pari, la rielaborazione condivisa, la riflessione sul metodo di lavoro., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., La robotica educativa, cioè la metodologia che prevede un impiego didattico della robotica, si propone di coinvolgere studenti di ogni età, dalla scuola di infanzia alle superiori, nello studio delle materie scientifico tecnologiche in maniera diversa. L’apprendimento avviene emergendo dal lavoro di gruppo, da un nuovo ruolo dell’insegnante (che "scavalca la cattedra" ed entra nel gruppo, guidando la scoperta). Si introduce un nuovo concetto di errore, non più come giudizio negativo, ma come incentivo a fare meglio. La robotica permette di lavorare con strumenti che possono coinvolgere ragazzi anche molto diversi tra loro, per provenienza culturale e linguistica, per età, per stile di apprendimento.Le esperienze di robotica educativa sono estremamente inclusive, i ragazzi più dotati e quelli con difficoltà di apprendimento sono accomunati nella progettazione, nella costruzione, nella programmazione di piccoli robot lavorando in gruppo e mettendo in mostra i propri talenti, le proprie intelligenze diverse, evidenziandole agli occhi dei docenti e dei propri compagni. Il riconoscere l’intelligenza dell’altro anche se diverso è il primo passo per l’integrazione completa di stranieri, portatori di handicap, o studenti “difficili”.I progetti di robotica educativa sono abitualmente usati in Europa anche per migliorare l’apprendimento di genere, consentendo alle ragazze di non allontanarsi dalle materie scientifico-tecnologiche., License: 'None (All rights reserved)'. For additional information or questions regarding copyright, distribution and reproduction, visit http://vishub.org/terms_of_use .

title: Planeta MARTE-un proiect pentru umanitate
description: Deşi niciun astronaut nu a păşit încă pe Marte, oamenii de ştiinţă se pregătesc deja pentru ziua în care pământenii vor ajunge pe planeta roşie. Lecţia propusă este utilă pentru descoperirea diferitelor caracteristici ale sistemului solar, /*în special a planetei Marte*/, folosind /*aplicația WorldWide Telescope*/ [1] ce ne transpune  într-o realitate virtuală în care putem explora lucruri noi referitoare la tematica abordată. Datorită complexității subiectului propus, planul de lecţie poate fi folosit inter și/sau transdisciplinar –/* astronomie, geografie, fizică, biologie, istorie etc.*/, motivarea elevilor și atitudinea pozitivă reprezentând punctul de plecare al acestui demers didactic. Pornind de la conţinutul ştiinţific şi folosind aplicaţiile propuse, elevii vor fi implicaţi individual sau pe echipe în activităţi de colaborare, comunicare, creaţie care se vor materializa în realizarea mai multor materiale digitale transdisciplinare cu implicare în viaţa reală. [1] http://www.golabz.eu/lab/worldwide-telescope, This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., License: 'Creative Commons Attribution'. title: ViSH Viewer (INTED 2013)
description: An effective K-12 science education is essential to succeed in future phases of the curriculum and the e-Infrastructures for education provide new opportunities to enhance it. This paper presents ViSH Viewer, an innovative web tool to consume educational content which aims to facilitate e-Science infrastructures access through a next generation learning object called “Virtual Excursion”. Virtual Excursions provide a new way to explore science in class by taking advantage of e-Infrastructure resources and their integration with other educational contents, resulting in the creation of a reusable, interoperable and granular learning object. In order to better understand how this tool can allow teachers and students a joyful exploration of e-Science, we also present three Virtual Excursion examples. Details about the design, development and the tool itself are explained in this paper as well as the concept, structure and metadata of the new learning object., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., Present VISH Viewer, an innovative HTML5 web application, License: 'Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial'. title: Investigare sui terremoti
description: Utilizzando un archivio dei terremoti storici più rilevanti gli studenti raccoglieranno informazioni e localizzeranno  sul planisfero i siti in cui si sono verificati, per osservare come si distribuiscono sulla superficie terrestre.Ogni coppia di studenti deve ricercare i terremoti più forti relativamente ad un certo periodo di tempo e compilare una tabella e poi tracciare le posizioni dei terremoti su un planisfero, distinguendo così distinte zone sismiche, al fine di individuare la corrispondenza tra i margini di placca e la distribuzione dei terremoti.Tutto ciò avviene prima di mostrare alla classe il planisfero delle placche tettoniche, al fine di condurre alla scoperta delle stesse grazie alla presente attività., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., License: 'Creative Commons Attribution'. title: Identificación de Minerales
description: Identificaremos minerales en el laboratorio gracias a códigos QR.Hemos escogido los minerales más habituales y así, cada profesor podrá adaptar nuestra idea a su laboratorio., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., El estudio de los minerales suele ser un tema árido para los alumnos de los cursos inferiores. Por ello, los alumnos de Geología de 2º de bachillerato, intentamos transmitir el interés que nosotros mismos tenemos, a través de esta actividad lectiva al tiempo que sencilla.OBJETIVOS:- Intentar que los alumnos adquieran, de forma divertida, conocimientos sobre los minerales de nuestro laboratorio de geología.- Incrementar la competencia científica. Identificaremos minerales atendiendo a sus propiedades físicas y químicas, siguiendo el guión de prácticas de ViSH en el móvil al tiempo que nos sirve como  guía de minerales, con indicación de las características generales y localización geográfica.- Incrementar la competencia digital. Utilización de códigos QR, uso de móviles o tablets, manejo de la plataforma ViSH en el aula.Nota.- Hemos adaptado los tamaños de letra y las características de escritura a un visionado sencillo desde nuestro móvil., License: 'Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial'. For additional information or questions regarding copyright, distribution and reproduction, visit http://vishub.org/terms_of_use ., Buenísima excursión, empezaré en 1º de ESO con minerales, la utilizaré.Dejo además mi enhorabuena por la excursión del mes, Si imprimes los códigos QR de los minerales para poder pegarlos a las cajas de minerales. Si haces una búsqueda de un mineral, te debería salir la imagen del mineral, el código QR y la e-excursion. Gracias Marisa!!, Great job. Good practise to adopt to other subjcts distiguishing.Thanks for inspitation. From 3rd Summer school in Split conference.

title: In the shadows...
description: The phenomenon of shadow was, from antiquity, well defined as the absence of light. Aristotle, in fact, had argued for a spherical earth believing that the curved lines on the lunar surface produced by the shadow of a spherical earth, which interweaved between the sun and the moon (Grant 2011, p.95). The present didactic proposal, for typical and SEN students, is participation for Open Discovery Space’s (ODS) contest for educational scenario of 2014-15 (Greece). It forms IBSE learning model and emphasis was given to the association of the content with every day life, to peer-to-peer education and to the big ideas of science (Harlen 2010). This didactic proposal is supported by a Teaching Plan and Inquiry Learning Spaces (ILS) in Greek and English. Students, working in groups, initially invited to engage in an exploration of the phenomenon of shadow using interactive whiteboard and the learning object “Shadow (umbra and penumbra)” from photodentro.edu.gr (see here http://goo.gl/iwW0zh). Moreover, the use metamemory questions is aiming at self-regulation of learning through Judgments of Learning (JOLs) and Ease of Learning,(EOLs) judgments (Karably & Zabrucky 2009)., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., License: 'Creative Commons Attribution'. title: Stars Wars. Episodio I: LA AMENAZA FANTASMA.
description: Esta es una película de ciencia ficción llena de efectos especiales que innovaron el cine de aquellos años y sorprendio a todo al que la fue a ver por primera vez. En ella ademas de sorprendentes efectos especiales, se describe la Galaxia desde el punto de vista de la mente creadora de esta película,concretamente nos habla de un pequeño planeta llamado Naboo, el cual obviamente no existe, en el  se centran practicamente todos los acontecimientos que suceden a lo largo de la película.Esta nos cuenta que  la República Galáctica está sumida en el caos. Los impuestos de las rutas comerciales a los sistemas estelares exteriores están en disputa. Por otro lado esperando resolver el asunto con un bloqueo de poderosas naves de guerra, la codiciosa Federación de Comercio ha detenido todos los envíos al pequeño planeta de Naboo.Para resolver este problema  el Canciller Supremo del Congreso de la Repúblicaha enviado en secreto a dos Caballeros Jedi, guardianes de la paz y la justicia en la galaxia., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., License: 'None (All rights reserved)'. title: El Olivo
description: El Olivo es un que puede alcanzar hasta los 10 metros de altura.Sus hojas son perennes, con forma lanceolada, que pueden medir de 2 a 8 cm de longitud; el haz de éstas es verde-grisáceo mientras que el envés es de color plateado. Las flores son hermafroditas, muy pequeñas que forman numerosos racimos. El fruto es la aceituna, de cuyo zumo se obtiene el aceite.Los olivos se hallan amplia mente cultivados en toda el área Mediterránea, sobre todo en el sur de la Península Ibérica., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., License: 'Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial'. title: ...υπό σκιάν
description: Το φαινόμενο της σκιά ήταν ανέκαθεν ξεκαθαρισμένο ως απουσία φωτός. Ο Αριστοτέλης, μάλιστα, είχε επιχειρηματολογήσει υπέρ μιας σφαιρικής γης πιστεύοντας ότι οι καμπύλες γραμμές στη σεληνιακή επιφάνεια δημιουργούνται από τη σκιά μιας σφαιρικής γης, που παρεμβάλλεται ανάμεσα στον ήλιο και το φεγγάρι (Grant 2011, p.95). Η παρούσα διδακτική πρόταση, για μαθητές τυπικής ανάπτυξης και μαθητἐς με ειδικές εκπαιδευτικές ανάγκες ή/και αναπηρία, είναι η συμμετοχή στο διαγωνισμό Εκπαιδευτικού Σεναρίου τουOpen Discovery Space (ODS) 2014-15. Ανήκει στο διερευνητικό μοντέλο μάθησης και έμφαση δόθηκε στη σύνδεση του περιεχομένου με την καθημερινή ζωή, στην εκπαίδευση μεταξύ ομοτίμων (Νεράντζης 2014, Πιερράτος 2013) και στις μεγάλες ιδέες της επιστήμης (Harlen 2010). Αυτή η διδακτική πρόταση υποστηρίζεται από ένα σχέδιο διδασκαλίας (δείτε εδώ: http://wp.me/p3oRiZ-eW) και Χώρους Διερευνητικής Μάθησης χώρους (ILS) στα Ελληνικά και Αγγλικά. Οι μαθητές εργάζονται σε ομάδες και καλούνται να συμμετάσχουν σε μια διερεύνηση του φαινομένου της σκιάς με χρήση διαδραστικού πίνακα και του μαθησιακού αντικειμένου «Σκιά – Παρασκιά” από photodentro.edu.gr (δείτε εδώ http://goo.gl/iwW0zh). Επιπλέον, με τη σχρήση μεταμνημονικών ερωτἠσεων στοχεύεται η αυτο-ρύθμιση της μάθησης μέσωμέσω των κρίσεων μάθησης (Judgments of Learning, JOLs) και των κρίσεων ευκολίας της µάθησης (Ease of Learning, EOLs) (Καραγιάννη 2013 – σελ.8, Karably & Zabrucky 2009)., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., License: 'Creative Commons Attribution'. title: Build an atom
description: This Inquiry Learning Space is designed for young Chemistry students of lower secondary school (12-15 years old) and aims at introducingan atom’s main "building blocks": protons, neutron and electrons.Students will “build” atoms through the addition or removal of protons, neutrons and electrons. Through this activity they will discover in a fun, interactive and easy way: * The position of each particle in an atom * The charge of each particle and how this contributes to the charge of an   atom * The link of the number of particles with the mass and atomic number of an   atom * The link of the number of protons with the position of an element in the   atomic table.Students will also be introduced to the first and second energy level, the stability or instability of an atom and a teacher can decide whether to use the orbit or the cloud model.The learning approach is divided into two activities:/Activity 1: “Atom”/In this activity students “build” four different atoms. They do this by adding or removing particles to their atoms, through dragging them in and out of the atom model. During this activity, the online lab notes the net charge of the atom and its mass number, as well as the element’s name, whether it is neutral or an ion and whether it is stable or not./Activity 2: “Symbol”/Once again, students add or remove protons, electrons and neutrons to an atom, but this time focus on the symbol of the atom (including the mass and atomic number) and its position in the periodic table., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., License: 'Creative Commons Attribution'. title: Citizen Science at schools

title: pH scale ILS
description: This Inquiry Learning Space is designed for young Chemistry students of lower secondary school (12-15 years old) and aims at introducing the pH concept and scale.It is based on a pHET simulation which is simple to use and involves the characterisation of familiar solutions into acids or bases. Furthermore, it studies the effect of volume and dilution to the pH of a solution.The benefit of conducting this lab virtually is that students can test liquids that are normally difficult to test in “real” labs, such as vomit and blood. It is also easy and quick to use and overcomes practical problems such as pH-meter calibration, need of multiple instruments and resources, lack of time and other educational difficulties, whilst at the same time offering a fun and informative introduction to the pH scale. During this activity the students are able to conduct three different experiments:/Experiment 1: pH measurement the pH of 11 familiar liquids and classification into acids or bases/In this experiment students “test” the pH of 11 different liquids from their everyday life, such as blood, spit, soda pop, battery acid and water, though the use of an electronic pH-meter, which they are supposed to classify into acids or bases. Through this activity they are also included to neutral solutions./Experiment 2: Influence of volume to the pH./In this phase the students test whether volume has an effect on a liquid’s pH./Experiment 3: Influence of dilution to the pH./In this experiment students test whether dilution (the addition of water) affects a liquid’s pH and note the difference between an acid and a base, as in both cases the pH approaches 7 (in the case of an acid in increases, whilst in the case of a base it decreases).Throughout the activity the students are required to answer a number of questions that require critical thinking and link the concept of pH to real life (e.g. why does drinking soda pop help soothe a tummy ache)., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., License: 'Creative Commons Attribution'. For additional information or questions regarding copyright, distribution and reproduction, visit http://vishub.org/terms_of_use .

title: Biodiversity of plants,birds and animals
description: Welcome! /Plant Diversity/ .Environmental pollution has an adverse effect on plants especially those medicinal that have beneficial effects on the health of the body.The main causes of the disappearance of plant and animal species are: destruction of habitats, commercial exploitation (the collection of plants, hunting and poaching irrational), the damage produced by acclimatized species and pollution. Of these cases, the destruction of Habitat is the greatest threat to these species.Maintaining existing ecosystems, such as coral reefs, forests, or swamps, depends largely on their biodiversity. The disappearance of one of the species that make up a food chain can lead to the decline of the ecosystem in question. Irreversible decline of biodiversity has a serious impact on the living standards of the people. Healthy ecosystems provide food, clean air, water and fertile soil for agriculture. Also, 40% of modern drugs are derived from plants and animals., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., License: 'Creative Commons Attribution'. title: Robotica educativa
description: Nella società che sta mutando, lo sviluppo delle scienze e della tecnologia ha cambiato il nostro modo di vivere e di comunicare. Le informazioni che giungono attraverso diversi tipi di canali di comunicazione, impongono che i ragazzi imparino a interpretarle, per essere protagonisti attivi in grado di porsi problemi, comprendere le cause e studiare strategie efficaci di risoluzione, acquisendo consapevolezza delle conseguenze delle proprie scelte. L’utilizzo della robotica educativa consente un apprendimento partecipato e costruito a partire dall’esperienza. I ragazzi acquisiscono competenze attraverso la ricerca, il confronto tra pari, la rielaborazione condivisa, la riflessione sul metodo di lavoro., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., La robotica educativa, cioè la metodologia che prevede un impiego didattico della robotica, si propone di coinvolgere studenti di ogni età, dalla scuola di infanzia alle superiori, nello studio delle materie scientifico tecnologiche in maniera diversa. L’apprendimento avviene emergendo dal lavoro di gruppo, da un nuovo ruolo dell’insegnante (che "scavalca la cattedra" ed entra nel gruppo, guidando la scoperta). Si introduce un nuovo concetto di errore, non più come giudizio negativo, ma come incentivo a fare meglio. La robotica permette di lavorare con strumenti che possono coinvolgere ragazzi anche molto diversi tra loro, per provenienza culturale e linguistica, per età, per stile di apprendimento.Le esperienze di robotica educativa sono estremamente inclusive, i ragazzi più dotati e quelli con difficoltà di apprendimento sono accomunati nella progettazione, nella costruzione, nella programmazione di piccoli robot lavorando in gruppo e mettendo in mostra i propri talenti, le proprie intelligenze diverse, evidenziandole agli occhi dei docenti e dei propri compagni. Il riconoscere l’intelligenza dell’altro anche se diverso è il primo passo per l’integrazione completa di stranieri, portatori di handicap, o studenti “difficili”.I progetti di robotica educativa sono abitualmente usati in Europa anche per migliorare l’apprendimento di genere, consentendo alle ragazze di non allontanarsi dalle materie scientifico-tecnologiche., License: 'Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial'. For additional information or questions regarding copyright, distribution and reproduction, visit http://vishub.org/terms_of_use .

title: Forest Fires. Planet Earth is calling...S.O.S.
description: During August 2007our prefecture, Ilia, faced the most horrific fire in our history. Moscow fires,during summer 2010, caused similar disaster. So there is a need for a common approach in terms of Environmental Educationworldwide.The aim of this excursion is to make people think about environment more seriously.Important note: All the material is original (booklets, experiment videos, earth's message, drawings) and were produced by our pupils and the teacher during our project about plants., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., Important note: All the material is original (booklets, experiment videos, earth's message, drawings) and were produced by our pupils and the teacher during our project about plants.After our activities, pupils will:    Understand through experiment the way roots support the plants.    Understand through experiment soil’s additional and auxiliary role on plant’s support and the interactive relation between roots and soil.    Conclude and rate from the above, forest’s importance on soil’s support and protection from flood.    Acquire awareness of the danger our planet is going through and realize that every living object deserves our respect and protection.    Learn to work in groups and understand that team work is more effective as they develop communication skills and sociability.    Improve their I.C.T. skills and performance., License: 'Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial'. title: FOOD SAFETY AND FOOD DEFENS
description: La seguridad alimentaria es un requisito indispensable en nuestro sistema sanitario nacional. Para lograr alcanzar los mayores estándares de calidad alimentaria e inocuidad de los alimentos es preciso implantar sistemas de control y trazabilidad en todos los procesos llevados a cabo por la industria alimentara. Al mismo tiempo, las tendencias globales de exportación de nuevos alimentos a países como Estados Unidos han traído consigo la necesidad de coordinar de forma globalizada procedimientos que eviten el uso de los alimentos como armas contra la sociedad. En este sentido, ambos conceptos, food safety y food defens, se complementa, evitando tanto los riesgo fortuitos como los intencionados, y aseguran la inocuidad de los alimentos a escala global., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., License: 'Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial'. title: La eutrofización
description: Esta excursión trata de explicar el concepto de eutrofización y la relación que existe entre este hecho y la contaminación de ríos y lagos debido a la introdución de bionutrientes que producen un incremento en la productividad biológica que acaba por alterar todo un ecosistema., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., El concepto de eutroficación es un concepto complejo, que requiere entender todos los pasos que llevan a que se desencadene en un determinado ecosistema. En dicho proceso juega un papel importante el ser humano y las actividades que realiza, sobre todo con la introducción de bionutrientes en ecosistemas cerrrados. La idea de esta excursión es comenzar relatando un caso real y a partir de el ver que y como ha ocurrido y buscar la manera de evitar este efecto en el futuro., License: 'None (All rights reserved)'. For additional information or questions regarding copyright, distribution and reproduction, visit http://vishub.org/terms_of_use .

title: Kas on hea olla ilus? - Selgitame evolutsiooni läbi loodusliku ja sugulise valiku
description: Õpid kui tähtis on evolutsiooni mõistmiseks aru saada loodusliku ja sugulise valiku protsessidest. Nende teemade õppimiseks töötad läbi uurimistsükli, mis koosneb viiest uurimisetapist (suunaseadmine; küsimuste ja hüpoteeside püstitamine; uurimine; järeldamine; arutelu). Lisaks bioloogia õppimisele omandad ka teadusliku uurimuse läbiviimiseks vajalikud oskused. Samuti on Sul hea võimalus läbi viia katseid virtuaalses laboris „Suguline valik gupidel" (Sexual Selection in Guppies) ja koguda ning analüüsida andmeid samamoodi nagu bioloog John Endler, kui ta uuris 1970ndatel aastatel esmakordselt gupide loodusliku ja sugulise valiku tasakaalu., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., License: 'Creative Commons Attribution'. title: Δασικές πυρκαγιές. Ο πλανήτης Γη καλεί...S.O.S.
description: Τον Αύγουστο του 2007 ο Νομός Ηλείας ήρθε αντιμέτωπος με την πιο καταστροφική πυρκαγιά της ιστορίας του. Οι φωτιές στη Μόσχα το καλοκαίρι του 2010 προξένησαν παρόμοιες καταστροφές. Έτσι δημιουργείται η ανάγκη για μια κοινή προσέγγιση στα πλαίσια της περιβαλλοντικής αγωγής, παγκοσμίως.Ο σκοπός αυτής της ηλ. εκδρομής είναι να κάνει τους ανθρώπους να σκεφτούν το περιβάλλον πιο σοβαρά., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., Μετά την εκδρομή αυτή, οι μαθητές θα:Έχουν γνωρίσει το ρόλο των ριζών στη στήριξη του εδάφους.Εκτιμήσουν τη χρησιμότητα των δασών για τη συγκράτηση των υδάτων.Επαναπροσδιορίσουν τη χρήση των διαφόρων πηγών θέρμανσης με όφελος το περιβάλλον.Κτίσουν ισχυρή περιβαλλοντική συνείδηση., License: 'Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial'. title: Is Radioactivity always harmful for humans?
description: This Inquiry Learning Space aims at understanding the different types of radioactivity particles and the basics about radioactivity decay. Factors that influence the radioactivity intensity (distance from radioactivity source, exposure time and presence of absorbers) will also be discussed.The Radioactivity Lab examines the intensity of radiation over distance, demonstrating the effects of the inverse square law. Students investigate the intensity of radiation being emitted from a radioactive Strontium-90 source, by setting distances at which a Geiger counter measures radiation, and collecting radioactive particle counts at each of these distances. A table holding the radioactive source is rotated until the source is aligned with a hole in a thick lead plate. The head holding the Geiger-Muller tube is moved to these distances from the radioactive source., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., License: 'Creative Commons Attribution'. title: Earth's magnetic field: cutting edge research in its past, present and future
description: Interactive movie aimed at your students, age 10 to 14.Cutting edge research in this domain is introduced, focusing on the change of the magnetic field in the past and the future.In this movie, you will learn about the impact of the Earth's magnetic field on our daily life, the change in the magnetic field over the years and millions of years, and the description of what happens during a pole reversal., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., This video presents three cutting edge research videos, carried out by Prof A. Jackson and Prof D. Gubbins, on the evolution of the magnetic field through time, firstly in the past using ship logs data and in the future, looking at how this field could change during a pole reversal event. This video also presents the shape of the magnetic dipole as we go deeper towards the Earth's core. The oversimplified dipole evolves into a rather complex quadrupole structure. , License: 'Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial'. title: Is it Good to be Beautiful - Understanding Evolution through Natural and Sexual Selection
description: This inquiry activity teaches students about the importance of natural and sexual selection processes in understanding evolution. It allows students to conduct scientific experiments using the online laboratory /Sexual Selection in Guppies /and collect & analyze data just like the biologist John Endler did when he first investigated the balance of natural and sexual selection in guppy fish in the 1970s. Students work through an inquiry cycle model and acquire scientific investigative skills that actual biologists and other scientists apply when making discoveries and investigating new phenomena., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., License: 'Creative Commons Attribution'. title: Kas on hea olla ilus? 2015
description: Õpid kui tähtis on evolutsiooni mõistmiseks aru saada loodusliku ja sugulise valiku protsessidest. Nende teemade õppimiseks töötad läbi uurimistsükli, mis koosneb viiest uurimisetapist (suunaseadmine; küsimuste ja hüpoteeside püstitamine; uurimine; järeldamine; arutelu). Lisaks bioloogia õppimisele omandad ka teadusliku uurimuse läbiviimiseks vajalikud oskused. Samuti on Sul hea võimalus läbi viia katseid virtuaalses laboris „Suguline valik gupidel" (Sexual Selection in Guppies) ja koguda ning analüüsida andmeid samamoodi nagu bioloog John Endler, kui ta uuris 1970ndatel aastatel esmakordselt gupide loodusliku ja sugulise valiku tasakaalu., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., License: 'Creative Commons Attribution'. title: Forest Fires. Planet Earth is calling...S.O.S.
description: During August 2007our prefecture, Ilia, faced the most horrific fire in our history. Moscow fires,during summer 2010, caused similar disaster. Conclude and rate from the above, forest’s importance on soil’s support and protection from flood.    Acquire awareness of the danger our planet is going through and realize that every living object deserves our respect and protection.    Learn to work in groups and understand that team work is more effective as they develop communication skills and sociability.    Improve their I.C.T. skills and performance., License: 'None (All rights reserved)'. title: HIGGS PARTICLE: Something very small that makes all the difference
description: A brief history of Higgs particle discovery through ideas and experiments: An excursion from the origin of the Universe to the Large Hadron Collider at CERN., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., To see how reality suggests ideas about the origin of the Universe and how these ideas are checked by experiments., License: 'Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial'. For additional information or questions regarding copyright, distribution and reproduction, visit http://vishub.org/terms_of_use ., I do not like criticizing other people's work, but there are three main problems with your presentation: 1. The Higgs boson is not the solution of how all the elementary particles get masses, you can do that without the Higgs for all the particles except for the W and Z bosons. 2. The question "what did it make the difference?" is more related with "why the masses of the elementary particles are so different?", which is a question that the Higgs mechanism cannot answer. And 3. In page 17 you are forgetting A. Migdal and A. Polyakov, which also gave an explanation for that more or less at the same time as these other people, but it was forgotten because of the Iron Curtain., This presentation is only a first approximation to Higgs particle. Sure there are much more details., Nice resource, Very good

title: Propiedades de los materiales
description: Propiedades de los materiales industriales. Ejercicios con solución., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., Obtiene los datos de los materiales de elementos de máquinas, relacionando las características de los mismos con sus requerimientos, funcionales, técnicos y económicos.Criterios de evaluación:a) Se han relacionado las propiedades físicas, químicas y mecánicas de los materiales con las necesidades de los elementos.b) Se ha relacionado la influencia existente entre los procesos de fabricación y las propiedades del material.c) Se han relacionado los tratamientos térmicos y termoquímicos empleados respecto de sus efectos sobre los materiales.d) Se ha identificado la necesidad de protección o lubricación en los materiales usados.e) Se ha identificado la influencia de las propiedades del material en el desarrollo de los procesos de mantenimiento industrial., License: 'Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial'. title: Galaxy classification and formation
description: This activity aims to introduce to students the concept of varying galactic morphologies. Students will look in detail at images of numerous galaxies derived from the ‘Faulkes telescopes’ and they will attempt to classify them according to their own notion and then according to the Hubble Classification Scheme. title: La Ola
description: La Ola es una película basada en hechos reales. Trata de un profesor que tiene que dar una clase de Anarquía y hace un experimento con los alumnos porque ellos creen que no podría volver a surgir un régimen como el de Hitler. Él a través de su lema: el poder mediante la disciplina, fuerza mediante la comunidad, fuerza a través de la acción, fuerza a través del orgullo, haciendo hincapié en ello, consigue de tal forma que cada día los alumnos siguieran una nueva regla. , This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., License: 'None (All rights reserved)'. description: Der neue Erlass fordert Schulen auf, den Gender-Aspekt bei allen berufsorientierenden Vorhaben in der Schule zu beachten und den Zukunftstag in das schulische Konzept zur Berufsorientierung einzubinden und aktiv zu gestalten.

title: Gender und Grundschule
description: Gender, Grundschule, nli.-Bericht

title: Gender und Grundschule
description: Grundschule, Gender, nli-Bericht

title: Gender und Migration
description: Informationen zu Thematik

title: Gender und Literatur
description: Aktuelle Literatur zum Thema Gender und Schule, Berufsorientierung, Gender Mainstream und Schule. Links, Verweise

title: Gender und Gymnasium
description: Das Gymnasium mit dem Abiturabschluss eröffnet die berufliche Perspektive auf Berufe, die eine akademische Grundbildung erfordern. Es gibt inzwischen mehr Mädchen an Gymnasien als Jungen. Sie machen die besseren Abschlüsse. Das Berufswahlspektrum hat sich bisher nicht nennenswert erweitert und Mädchen nutzen die am Gymnasium erworbene gute Qualifikation nur selten für eine z. B. akademische Laufbahn.

title: Selbstlernmodul
description: Modul mit drei Einheiten zum Themenfeld \\
